ygData.subject: Re: (no subject)
ygData.msgSnippet: I agree.  What better topic for a bard mailing list than a bard guild that seems to be doing very well?  It s not like other guilds can t speak up for
ygData.messageBody:
I agree. What better topic for a bard mailing list than a bard guild that seems to be doing very well? It's not like other guilds can't speak up for themselves. But I also agree with James' statement that this mailing list should be for tips, quests, hints, or game tactics, etc. I'll not say another word if no one agrees with me that it's annoying to read and delete 10 "Hello my name is" messages a day. Your character can be well introduced in a fitting thread, but I simply get a headache reading thees and thous and hails in a mailing list--with the message leading nowhere except to announce your character, presence, and server. In game is totally different, I just think it's out of place and consuming too much bandwidth here.


> ** Original Subject: [eqbards] Re: (no subject)
> ** Original Sender: "Gabriel" <gdiaz@...>
> ** Original Date: Wed, 21 Apr 1999 15:09:23 -0400

> ** Original Message follows...

>
> From: "Gabriel" <gdiaz@...>
>
> I don't feel he was commercializing it, more like defending against
> accusations.
>
> -----Original Message-----From: James Sparks <jchristophersparks@...>
> To: eqbards@onelist.com <eqbards@onelist.com>
> Date: Wednesday, April 21, 1999 2:41 PM
> Subject: [eqbards] Re: (no subject)
>
>
> >From: James Sparks <jchristophersparks@...>
> >
> >Try to use the message board for bards, not promoting your guild. So
> >one guy has a problem, and you can't please everybody. But try to help
> >bards out by tips, tactics and quest hints, not guild promotion. You
> >may be a good guild, I don't know, but please try to keep it
> >uncommercialized. Thankyou.
> >
> >For instance, any woodelf bard can give 4 spiderling silks to the guild
> >leader in kelethin and get a hand drum. This quest can be done over and
> >over and the drums can be sold for about 3-4 gold. Not to shabby for
> >newbies.
> >
